setting.name: PAN ID
setting.description: Set the PAN (Personal Area Network) ID the device should join (ZigBee extended PAN ID). Valid range is 0 - 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF. Alternatively, set ID=0 (default) for the device to join any PAN ID.

setting.name: Scan Channels
setting.description: Set/read list of channels to scan when joining a PAN as bitfield: Bit 15 = Chan 0x1A . . . Bit 0 = Chan 0x0B

setting.name: Scan Duration
setting.description: Set/read the Scan Duration exponent. The exponent configures the duration of the active scan (PAN scan) on each channel in the SC channel mask when attempting to join a PAN. Scan Time = SC * (2 ^ SD) * 15.36ms. (SC=# channels)

setting.name: ZigBee Stack Profile
setting.description: Set/read the ZigBee stack profile setting. 0=Network Specific, 1=ZigBee-2006, 2=ZigBee-PRO

setting.name: Node Join Time
setting.description: Set/read the Node Join time. The value of NJ determines the time (in seconds) that the device will allow other devices to join to it. If set to 0xFF, the device will always allow joining.

setting.name: Channel Verification
setting.description: Set/read the channel verification setting. If enabled, a router will verify a coordinator exists on the same channel after joining or power cycling to ensure it is operating on a valid channel, and will leave if a coordinator cannot be found (if NJ=0xFF). If disabled, the router will remain on the same channel through power cycles.

setting.name: Join Notification
setting.description: Set/read the join notification setting. If enabled, the module will transmit a broadcast node identification frame on power up and when joining. This action blinks the Assoc LED rapidly on all devices that receive the data, and sends an API frame out the UART of API devices. This function should be disabled for large networks.

setting.name: Operating PAN ID
setting.description: Read the operating PAN ID (ZigBee extended PAN ID).

setting.name: Operating 16-bit PAN ID
setting.description: Read the 16-bit operating PAN ID.

setting.name: Operating Channel
setting.description: Read the operating channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers).

setting.name: Number of Remaining Children
setting.description: Read the number of remaining end device children that can join this device. If NC=0, the device cannot allow any more end device children to join.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN. 0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the Pan Coordinator.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN. 0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the Pan Coordinator.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: Set/read Node Identifier string

setting.name: Maximum Hops
setting.description: Set/read the maximum hops limit. This limit sets the maximum number of broadcast hops (BH) and determines the unicast timeout (unicast timeout = (50 * NH) + 100). A unicast timeout of 1.6 seconds (NH=30) is enough time for the data and acknowledgment to traverse about 8 hops.

setting.name: Broadcast Radius
setting.description: Set/Read the transmission radius for broadcast data transmissions. Set to 0 for maximum radius.

setting.name: Many-to-One Route Broadcast Time
setting.description: Set/read the time between aggregation route broadcast times. An aggregation route broadcast creates a route on all devices in the network back to the device that sends the aggregation broadcast. Setting AR to 0xFF disables aggregation route broadcasting. Setting AR to 0 sends one broadcast.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: Set/read the device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Node Discovery Backoff
setting.description: Set/read Node Discovery backoff register. This sets the maximum delay for Node Discovery responses to be sent (ND, DN).

setting.name: Node Discovery Options
setting.description: Sets the node discovery options register. Options include 0x01 - Append DD value to end of node discovery, 0x02 - Return devices own ND response first.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: 16-bit Network Address
setting.description: Read the 16 bit Network Address for the modem. 0xFFFE means the device has not joined a PAN.

setting.name: Maximum Number of RF Payload Bytes
setting.description: Read the maximum number of RF payload bytes that can be sent in a single RF transmission. This number can change based on whether or not security is enabled (EE).

setting.name: ZigBee Source Endpoint
setting.description: Set/read the source endpoint used for serial data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple endpoints must be supported.

setting.name: ZigBee Destination Endpoint
setting.description: Set/read the destination endpoint used for serial data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple endpoints must be supported.

setting.name: ZigBee Cluster ID
setting.description: Set/read the cluster identifier value used for serial data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple cluster IDs must be supported.

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: Select/Read transmitter output power. (XBee-PRO supports a fixed output power.) Approximate power levels (XBee): 0= -7dBm, 1= -3dBm, 2= -1dBm, 3= +1dBm, 4= +3dBm.

setting.name: Power Mode
setting.description: Select/Read module boost mode setting. If enabled, boost mode improves sensitivity by 1dB and increases output power by 2dB, improving the link margin and range.

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable ZigBee encryption.

setting.name: Encryption Options
setting.description: Set the ZigBee Encryption options: Bit0 = Acquire / Transmit network security key unencrypted during joining.

setting.name: Encryption Key
setting.description: Sets key used for encryption and decryption (ZigBee trust center link key). This register can not be read.

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Set/read the serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host. Request non-standard baud rates above 0x12C using a terminal window. Read BD register to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Set/read number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: DIO7 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7 line of the module. Options include: CTS flow control, Digital Input and Output, or RS-485 enable control.

setting.name: DIO6 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6 line of the module. Options include: RTS flow control, and Digital Input and Output

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.

category.name: Sleep Modes
category.description: Configure low power options to support end device children

setting.name: Cyclic Sleep Period
setting.description: Set/read Cyclic sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes. Set SP on parent (Coordinator or Router) to match the largest SP of its end device children. On a router or coordinator, SP determines the transmission timeout when sending to a sleeping end device. SP also determines how long the parent will buffer a message for a sleeping child.

setting.name: Number of Cyclic Sleep Periods
setting.description: Set/read the number of cyclic sleep periods used to calculate end device poll timeout. If an end device does not send a poll request to its parent coordinator or router within the poll timeout, the end device is removed from the child table. The poll timeout is calculated in milliseconds as (3 * SN * (SP * 10ms)), minimum of 5 seconds. i.e. if SN=15, SP=0x64, the timeout is 45 seconds.

setting.name: AD0/DIO0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0 line of the module. Options include: Enabling commissioning button functionality, Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD1/DIO1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD2/DIO2 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD3/DIO3 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO4 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO4 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5/Assoc Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc line of the module. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated),Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO10/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10 line of the module. Options include: RSSI PWM Output, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO11 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO12 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: Pull-up Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pullup resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pullup enabled, 0=no internal pullup. Bitfield map: (12)-DIO11, (11)-DIO10/PWM0, (10)-DIO12, (9)-On/Sleep, (8)Associate, (7)-DIN/Config, (6)-Sleep_Rq, (5)-RTS, (4)-AD0/DIO0, (3)-AD1/DIO1, (2)-AD2/DIO2, (1)-AD3/DIO3, (0)-DIO4

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: Set/read the Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin if D5=1 and the module has started a network. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read PWM timer register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin (P6). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: IO Sampling Rate
setting.description: Set the IO sampling rate to enable periodic sampling. If set >0, all enabled digital IO and analog inputs will be sampled and transmitted every IR milliseconds. IO Samples are transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

setting.name: Digital IO Change Detection
setting.description: Bitfield that configures which digital IO pins should be monitored for change detection. If a change is detected on an enabled digital IO pin, a digital IO sample is immediately transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

setting.name: Supply Voltage High Threshold
setting.description: Configure the supply voltage high threshold. If the supply voltage measurement equals or drops below this threshold, the supply voltage will be included in an IO sample transmission.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read Association status code to monitor association progress.

setting.name: RSSI of Last Packet
setting.description: Read the RSSI of the last received packet.

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: Read the supply voltage of the module. The %V measurement returns { 4 * (Vcc/4) } where (Vcc/4) is the measured value from the 10-bit A/D read, and the (4*) multiple allows the application to use the same formula to convert %V into mV units as it would to convert any A/D reading to mV: mV = (%V) * (1200 / 1024). (1200mV is the A/D reference voltage.) A %V response of 0x900 (2304 decimal) represents 2700mV, or 2.7V.
